Liparini Pereira
Title:
First report of Gilbertella persicaria as the cause of soft
rot of fruit of Syzygium cumini
Abstract:
A zygomycetous fungus causing fruit soft rot was found on
Sygyzium cumini in Northeast Brazil. Based on morphological and
phylogenetic analyses, the fungus was identified as Gilbertella
persicaria. This is the first report of this fungus causing the decay of
S. cumini fruit worldwide.
